page.title: 07FARMING - ETTRICK VALLEY.
page.content: Farm Work - Farming is the main source of employment and the work is shepherding, working with cattle, and some tractor work. The busiest times are lambing in April and May, clipping in July, haymaking when the weather permits and the Autumn sales. Snow in Winter makes feeding livestock on the hills very difficult and can be the busiest time of all. Farm Crops - No cereals are grown and the fields are used for hay and silage. Silage is cut grass which is either put into a pit or put into big plastic bags and sealed. It is used for Winter feeding.
